Poetic Translation: Pale, white as death, and seven graves are there now;

Direct Translation: from you, my wife, I must be parted
Poetic Translation: We must be parted, my wife.

Lyrics: もの言ふ女かな　な　汝
Transliteration: mono yū omina kana na mashi
Direct Translation: the words of a woman like you
Poetic Translation: Obstinate are the words of woman.
You lie, robed in your linen;

Direct Translation: I the same as my wife
Poetic Translation: I, beside you, am the same.
Clothes just so, your back just so,
And your mouth softened in peace.

Direct Translation: I may look at what you wear
Poetic Translation: I think of you and your clothes.

Transliteration: Markham, Elizabeth. Saibara: Japanese Court Songs of the Heian Period. Vol. 2. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1983. Print.
